name: Giraffe
fact: a giraffe's neck can be up to 8 feet tall.

name: Hippopotamus
fact: the closest living relatives of the Hippopotamidae are cetaceans.

name: Western Green Mamba
fact: a single bite from the green bamba is enough to a kill a human.

name: Wildebeest
fact: wildebeests migrate close to 1600 km each year.

name: Lemur
fact: fossil remains of extinct lemurs indicate that some weighed as much as 440 lb.

name: African Elephant
fact: african elephants can live up to 70 years.

name: Zebra
fact: zebras are threatened by hunters, and habitat change from farming.

name: White Rhinoceros
fact: in Africa, 98.8 percent of white rhinos are in South Africa, Namibia, Zimbabwe, and Kenya.

name: Spotted Hyena
fact: spotted Hyenas hunt alone, in small groups or in large groups.

name: Cheetah
fact: cheetahs are capable of running over 60 mph.

name: African Hare
fact: African Hares can run up to 43 mph.

name: Baboon
fact: baboons are omnivorous and will eat just about anything.

name: Chimpanzee
fact: chimpanzees are currently being threatened by hunters for their bush meat.

name: Ostrich
fact: an ostrich egg is over 20 times the weight of a chicken's egg.

name: Warthog
fact: a warthog's tusks can grow up to 10 inches long.

name: White-backed vulture
fact: along with other vultures, they clear up to 70% of Africa's Carbon.

name: Porcupine
fact: porcupines are native to more than 30 African countries.

name: Wattled Crane
fact: the Wattled Crane has 1 mate for life.

name: Tree Pangolin
fact: the tree pangolin can walk on all fours or on just its hind legs.

name: African Lion
fact: the lion population has decreased 43% in the last 21 years.

name: Gerenuk
fact: the Gerenuk's pointed mouth helps it extract leaves from thorny vegetation.
